properties.areaDesc: Centennial Mountains/Island Park; Bear River Range; Sun Valley Region; Bear Lake Valley; Blackfoot Mountains; Teton Valley; Big Hole Mountains; Sawtooth/Stanley Basin; Caribou Range
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 14 at 3:07AM MST by NWS Pocatello ID
properties.description:
An active winter storm system will bring a combination of winds
and snow to portions of East Idaho beginning late Saturday and
continuing into Sunday night. Although forecast snow accumulations
continue to fluctuate slightly as the event nears, there is high
confidence that the Saturday night through Sunday time period will
have the potential to produce moderate to locally heavy snow
mainly over higher elevations of East Idaho. The areas expected
to see the greatest impact will be north of Ketchum through
Stanley, including the higher elevations of the Sawtooth
Recreation Area, as well as most of the higher elevations east of
Interstate 15 to the Wyoming border. Accumulations in these areas
are expected to fall in the 8 to 12 inch range for most locations
with locally higher amounts at pass level. Winds are expected to
increase as well, so areas of blowing and drifting snow may
further complicate already potentially hazardous driving
conditions. People living in or traveling through East Idaho this
weekend should continue to monitor the forecast for updates and be
prepared for winter travel conditions.

NWSheadline: WINTER IMPACTS EXPECTED THIS WEEKEND ACROSS PORTIONS OF EAST IDAHO
